III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Placement
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12404
Section (5) Before the placement of a child, the agency shall document
Description preparation of all relevant parties, including the child or infant,
which must include an explanation of all the following:
(a) The circumstances necessitating placement.
(b) The child’s individual needs.
(c) Any special challenges presented.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency placed a child and did not complete
the 3130A.
Investigation The Complainant in this case is anonymous therefore additional
needed information could not be obtained from this source. In
addition, the complainant did not identify a specific case(s) in
which the 3130A was not completed, Therefore, a random sample
of eight cases was reviewed. Each of the eight 3130A’s reviewed
were completed and were thorough.
During the 9/25/24 investigation initiation with the Chief
Administrator she reported that she was unaware of DHS
3130A’s not being completed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eight provider files were randomly selected out of a list of
fifteen files to which all files consisted of completed and
thorough 3130A’s.
Analysis The agency is in compliance with this rule as the cases reviewed
documented a completed 3130A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Required staff
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12205
Section • (8) An agency shall employ or contract for a sufficient
Description number of competent staff to carry out the provisions
2

covered by these rules. The workload for each staff
member may not be more than any of the following:
• (a) Five social service workers per supervisor.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency is over caseload.
Investigation Another DCWL Consultant recently completed an Interim
inspection of the agency on 09/26/24 and the report was sent to
the agency on 11/06/24. The DCWL Consultant cited the agency
for a violation of the rule and a corrective action plan is currently
required and due 11/20/24. Because of this, an investigation of the
alleged rule violation will not occur during this current special
investigation.
Analysis It was determined that the Interim corrective action plan is
sufficient to address the rule violation, and an additional violation
of the rule is not warranted
Conclusion Violation Not Established

Rule Code Medical and dental care policy
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12413
Section • (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
Description include all the following:
• (a) The provision of routine medical care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that medical care is not being provided.
Investigation The Complainant is anonymous therefore, additional needed
information could not be obtained from this source. In addition, the
complainant did not identify a specific case(s) in which medical
care was not being provided. Therefore, a random sample of eight
cases were reviewed. Each of the eight cases reviewed
documented timely Well Child exams and dental exams.
During the 9/25/24 investigation initiation with the Chief
Administrator she reported that she was unaware of required
medical care for children not being completed.
DOCUMENT Review:
• Eight foster child files were randomly selected and
reviewed out of a list of fifteen files.
• The agency’s medical care policy was reviewed and is
comprehensive.
Analysis Of the files reviewed each documented current medical exams
and dental exams.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
